page.title: 06STOKE DOYLE CHURCH
page.content: Unusually this church is called St.Rumbold's. It is situated about 100 metres from the pub at the centre of the village along Church Walk. The present building is said to date back to about 1200, although the register only dates back to 1650. In the eighteenth century the church fell into decay so it was pulled down completely and a new one built in 1722.It is the only eighteenth century church in the area which makes it even more unusual. It even has a flat roof! Inside the church is very symmetrical and is an L-shape with a side-chapel containing lovely marble statue of Sir Edward Ward erected in 1725. Inside the church there are 23 pews each of which can seat four or five people. Some of us went up the belfry and one of the group even showed us how to ring the bells!
